revised_title: Inheritance of Heterostylism in Primula: A Mendelian Approach
tldr: The authors, Bateson and Gregory, conducted experiments on the inheritance of heterostylism in Primula sinensis. They found that the characters of long-style and short-style have a Mendelian inheritance, with short style being dominant and long style being recessive. The study also explored the inheritance of flower color and other characters, and the authors discovered a peculiar type of Primula sinensis with a yellow flush, which they called "equal-styled." The inheritance of these traits follows the rules of Mendelian genetics.
